content: grandma s bowl cozy a pattern by hayley geary of @gothgrandmaknits this crochet potholder is the perfect size for pulling hot bowls from the microwave it can be worked up in a short time and would be a great addition to any kitchen materials ​ cotton yarn approximately 100 yards crochet hook h for crocheters with tight gauge or crochet hook g for crocheters with average or loose gauge notions ​ scissors darning needle to weave in ends if desired finished dimensions 4 5 in diameter 14 5 around approximate ​ instructions setup chain ​ with your desired size crochet hook and cotton yarn chain 4 leave approximately 4 - 5 tail slip_stitch into 1st chain creating a circle and chain 1 begin rounds ​ at the end of each round in this section sl into the chain 1 of the previous round chain 1 this step will be noted at the end of each round as a * ​ ​ round 1 single_crochet into each chain st * 4 sts ​ ​ round 2 single_crochet 2 into each single_crochet * 8 sts ​ ​ round 3 as round 2 * 16 sts ​ ​ round 4 as round 2 * 32 sts ​ ​ round 5 single_crochet into each single_crochet around * 32 sts ​ ​ round 6 as round 5 * 32 sts ​ ​ round 7 as round 5 * 32 sts ​ ​ round 8 single_crochet into next single_crochet single_crochet 2 into into next single_crochet repeat to end of round * 48 sts ​ ​ at this point you are done increasing and you will have 48 sts around for the remainder of the project round 9 work one single_crochet in each single_crochet around maintaining 48 sts until piece measures 3 5 from the center this will be approximately 12-14 repeats of round 9 for these rounds you may continue to work the * instructions above or you can opt to single_crochet over the seam created by the increase ​ ​ rounds and work continuously with no end of the round when you have reached desired height of the piece proceed to the next section do not break yarn adding handles ​ with your yarn still attached chain 8 skip 3 sts single_crochet into the next stitch to anchor your chain this is handle #1 single_crochet in each stitch until you get to the opposite side of your bowl chain 8 skip 3 sts single_crochet into the next stitch to anchor your chain this is handle #2 at this point you should have both handles attached each being made up of 8 chain sts single_crochet around the bowl until you reach handle #1 single_crochet 15 around your chain single_crochet across rim of the bowl to handle #2 repeat once finishing ​ fasten_off weave in ends block the piece if desired to your favorite bowl by lightly spraying your piece with water forming it to the shape of the bowl and allowing to dry
